17 September 2008

Online registration system for all new signatories    

The Global Compact Office is announcing the launch of the online registration system for all new signatories. All previously distributed paper forms should be taken out of circulation at this point, as they are no longer valid. In order to make the sign-up process more efficient, accurate and expeditious, all business and non-business organizations as of now are kindly requested to fill out the web-based Organization Information Form and upload their Letter of Commitment upon completion. Mailing of letters will no longer be necessary. Please contact Yuliya Vnukova at vnukova@un.org for further details.

Call for contributions to "Network News" section of the upcoming edition of the Compact Quarterly    

The next edition of the Compact Quarterly is currently in development and we would therefore like to use this opportunity to call for contributions to the "Network News" section. We would greatly appreciate receiving any news items regarding recent Network events and activities.  Related photographs would be welcome.  Please send submissions by Wednesday 1st October to Nessa Whelan whelan@un.org. 

HUMAN RIGHTS

CEO Statement to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights The Global Compact Office will in the coming weeks send to all participating CEOs a letter offering the opportunity to sign a statement that would be published in the Financial Times on 10 December 2008 - Human Rights Day.    

The statement is designed to demonstrate a consensus that human rights is universally relevant to business. Through this statement, we want to help mainstream human rights and get many more businesses thinking about human rights as an important business concern. A number of CEOs have already indicated that they would be willing to sign the statement. Achieving a good geographic and sectoral distribution of CEOs will be key.

The statement is as follows:

"On the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, we, business leaders from all corners of the world, call on governments to implement fully their human rights obligations.  We also reiterate our own commitment to respect and support human rights within our sphere of influence.  Human rights are universal and are an important business concern all over the globe."    

ENVIRONMENT

First meeting of Caring for Climate signatories

Global Energy Basel 2008, 12-14 November 2008, Switzerland

For more details on each    

A special "Caring for Climate" event will be organized on 10 December 2007 during the 13th Conference of the Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) in Bali, Indonesia.

The first meeting of Caring for Climate signatories will take place on 20-21 October 2008 at UN Headquarters in Geneva. We invite you to encourage the participants of your network to attend the event.

Since its launch by Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon in July 2007, Caring for Climate has mobilized the support of over 270 chief executives around the world with a strong interest from companies in emerging economies. The first meeting of the signatories aims to take stock of progress made and provide a business platform for sharing experiences in implementing climate strategies, lowering risk exposure and increasing business opportunities. In addition, the meeting will provide an opportunity for the signatories to meet experts and Government officials involved in designing the post-Kyoto framework and to discuss policy elements that would enable business to best address the climate challenge. 250 participants from business, civil society, Governments and the UN are expected to attend. For more information, please send an email to Lila Karbassi at karbassi@un.org.

The Global Compact encourages participants to attend the Global Energy Basel - an event dedicated to integrated energy solutions - to be held on 12-14 November 2008 at the Congress Center in Basel, Switzerland. The letter attached from Georg Kell was sent to 360 selected companies including all large Caring for Climate signatories on 15 September. The list of companies to which the letter was sent is available upon request. Please contact Lila Karbassi at karbassi@un.org.

ANTI-CORRUPTION

Transparency International's 13th International Anti-Corruption Conference, 30 October to 2 November 2008 in Athens, Greece Special private sector workshops will focus on promoting good corporate governance and transparency in business, effective anti-corruption programmes and risk mitigation strategies that contribute to companies’ sustainability efforts.    

The Global Compact, a supporting partner of the Conference would like to invite GC participants to the event.  

For more information, please contact Olajobi Makinwa at makinwa@un.org. For conference details and registration: www.13iacc.org, info@13iacc.org

PARTNERSHIPS

Global Compact announces partnership with the SEED Initiative    

Through an annual, global business awards scheme SEED highlights novel ways of doing business through partnerships and provides international recognition to the most promising enterprises.

SEED Award winners present excellent partners for Global Compact Local Networks to exchange experience and learning. GC Local Networks can also benefit from SEED’s Research and Learning Channel on entrepreneurship and sustainable development.

Further details are at www.seedinit.org and the SEED contact point is Helen.Marquard@seedinit.org Tel +44 7785 706 646
